metadata.title: CVE-2022-48697 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nvmet:fix a use-after-free Fix the following use-after-free complaint triggeredby blktests nvme/004: BUG: KASAN: user-memory-access inblk_mq_complete_request_remote+0xac/0x350 Read of size 4 at addr0000607bd1835943 by task kworker/13:1/460 Workqueue: nvmet-wqnvme_loop_execute_work [nvme_loop] Call Trace: show_stack+0x52/0x58dump_stack_lvl+0x49/0x5e print_report.cold+0x36/0x1e2kasan_report+0xb9/0xf0 __asan_load4+0x6b/0x80blk_mq_complete_request_remote+0xac/0x350nvme_loop_queue_response+0x1df/0x275 [nvme_loop]__nvmet_req_complete+0x132/0x4f0 [nvmet] nvmet_req_complete+0x15/0x40[nvmet] nvmet_execute_io_connect+0x18a/0x1f0 [nvmet]nvme_loop_execute_work+0x20/0x30 [nvme_loop] process_one_work+0x56e/0xa70worker_thread+0x2d1/0x640 kthread+0x183/0x1c0 ret_from_fork+0x1f/0x30

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48697` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-lowlatency - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1007-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1151-aws - 4.15.0-1151.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1146-gcp - 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1115-oracle - 4.15.0-1115.126~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1151.164~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1115.126~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
